HSI Header Utility

Detailed Description

The section has a list of all the exported API which the applications need to invoke in order to use the module.

Function Documentation

int32_t HSIHeader_createHeader ( CBUFF_SessionCfg *  ptrSessionCfg,
bool  bAlignDataCard,
HSIHeader *  ptrHeader,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
This is the function which is used to populate the HSI header using the CBUFF Session. This header should then be used to create the CBUFF session.

Parameters
[in]ptrSessionCfgPointer to the CBUFF session configuration
[in]bAlignDataCardFlag which indicates if the header created should be aligned in accordance with the data card requirements. Headers created in this mode could have a large amount of padding and could waste bandwidth.
[out]ptrHeaderPointer to the HSI Header which will be populated by the API.
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t HSIHeader_deinit ( int32_t *  errCode)

Description
This is the function which is used to deinitialize the HSI Header module

Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t HSIHeader_deleteHeader ( HSIHeader *  ptrHeader,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
This is the function which is used to delete the header and free up the identifer which had been allocated before.

Parameters
[out]ptrHeaderPointer to the HSI Header which has to be deleted
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
int32_t HSIHeader_init ( CBUFF_InitCfg *  ptrInitCfg,
int32_t *  errCode 
)

Description
This is the function which is used to initialize the HSI Header module

Parameters
[in]ptrInitCfgPointer to the CBUFF Initialization configuration
[out]errCodeError code populated on error
Return values
Success- 0
Error- <0
